intro: Colpodium variegatum f. leianthum, commonly known as the variegated colpodium, is a rare and distinctive variant of the colpodium plant. It is characterized by its striking variegation in leaf color, often displaying shades of white, yellow, and green. This form is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or along stream banks. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. Its unique foliage makes it a sought-after species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
